title: Riot, You Said Akali Will Recieve Changes Not Nerfs
body:
You said you have changes planned for Akali in 10.3. I looked at these changes and all I saw was straight nerfs. If she is going to be revealed in her shroud so easily AND have a decaying movement speed for only 2 secs, then what's the point of shroud?

Her R1 got changed to target champions but R1 does absolutely nothing. Her R2 is even worst since the travel speed is severly reduced. 
So you are saying that now I have to dash to a champion only to get stunned and die, then wait 3 mins to do it again? 

I never stopped playing Akali even when she got nerfed to the ground in 9.3 and I was hoping for more thoughtful Akali changes after worlds. But this is going to drop her to %30 or less winrate. Akali is officially dead in 10.3.
I suggest these changes stay on PBE for a very long testing period until you can get it right with feedback.

replies.body:
I think it's just generally shitty to play a game with point and click champions.

I think point and clicking is generally not fun, boring, offers no opportunity for skill nor counterplay.

But eh. I guess a predictable R on Akali's ult will make things fun.

True, this was one of the reasons I didn't like the old Akali as much as the new one. The R change will make Akali too predictable though. She is going to dive in, get cced and die. Then she will have to wait 3 mins to int again. They should have at least buffed some things along with these changes.

>  If she is going to be revealed in her shroud so easily

Because hitting a CC on a champion that is invisible, has 4 dashes and a lot of ms boosts is "so easy"

> have a decaying movement speed for only 2 secs

And 4 dashes, and 2 ms boosts on any spell she hits. Why should she even get a ms boost on her W?

> Her R1 got changed to target champions but R1 does absolutely nothing

Except that its a dash, and it procs her passive

> Her R2 is even worst since the travel speed is severly reduced.

So its actually possible to dodge?

Have you even read the twitter post?

You know something is TOO FUCKING much when there's just 1 person saying it's a good nerf in total, and everyone else, including people who admit they hate Akali and she's their permaban and that they won't stop banning her anyway, yet still say these nerfs are too much.

When mains say something is too much: maybe, maybe not, depends on the mains who cry it.
When randoms say something is too much: it has a big probability to be too much.
When people who hate the champion with a passion say something is too much: it is too fucking much.

Even people who hate her say they don't agree with the removal of skill expression from her R.

How much more you want?

I want ALL her ms buffs, range buff on her passive AA and Q slow to be gone.
I want her to land her abilities to chase people and do damage, instead of using W, running in and hitting Q-AA-Q-AA
If I am 1000 range away from her, I want her to at least waste her E and R1 to reach me, so that I can actually try to survive by forcing her to R2 early while I am still high health.
Is that too much? Is having actual counterplay too much for Akali mains? Well, I am not Akali main, and for all I care, she can be nerfed to 10% winrate and 0 pickrate and that would be better for the game itself than what we have here.
Skill expression on R? Rly? R1 is used either to get close enough, as an escape tool or as a dodge tool. It could deal 1 damage and nobody would notice

You are just crying for the sake of crying and haven't read the notes at all, have you?

Here: https://twitter.com/MarkYetter/status/1217939928924868608?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1217939928924868608&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dexerto.com%2Fleague-of-legends%2Fmajor-akali-nerfs-lol-patch-10-3-pbe-1314179

None of the things you want are there.

I'm an Akali main, and as many others said even in that tweet, I fully support nerfing her passive, nerfing her Q damage. I'm ok with those to happen.

But if they do that, she'll require much more skill to play, and we can't have that, can we? I mean, look at so many other changes such as Sylas or A-Sol or Ryze, done to make them easier to play, not to have more counter play.

They are trying to do the same with Akali and trust me when I say that no Akali main in his/her's/IO's right mind wants that. We want Akali to be hard to play and have counter play. Many mains actually suggested Q and P nerfs, but no-one 'cept for Jhonny from Plastic 12 gets what they want.

> None of the things you want are there.

Her W speed boost is much weaker, just like I wanted(although its still there), her R1 now requires her to be in range(so she can't use it from 1k range just to position herself for E or back-E and Q) and she can only use it on a champion (so she can't R-E, can't use it to escape or dodge). And while I was ok with her R2 being a reliable execute that, however, puts her in danger with no dashes left, the nerf is not that hard on it.

> But if they do that, she'll require much more skill to play

If they do that, she will turn into a normal assassin: using full combo to kill someone and leave. Again, I would be ok with that, but Riot want her to be a "sustained damage assassin" that can kill people without using any huge cooldowns and uses those cooldowns mostly to survive/dodge/chase/finish rather than for just damage. Which is understandable(even if I don't agree with that), because a) thats how old Akali worked and b) there are no other champions that do it.

> look at so many other changes such as Sylas or A-Sol or Ryze

I didn't really play Sylas or Ryze, but Sol's mini-rework added some(well, maybe too much) counterplay to his push-roam strategy, decreased his best-case damage, and compensated it with better tools to survive/outplay/burst and made players no longer feel bad at maxing Q second. Sure, he lost some uniqueness, but got some actual ability to do things in fights that's not "if anyone gets in melee range, Im dead, so I should just stay away with my W enabled"

Her speed boost is 30% up to 50% and can be used while outside her W.

The one on live is 20-40% only when inside.

So.....maybe read again?

You:
>If I am 1000 range away from her, I want her to at least waste her E and R1 to reach me, so that I can actually try to survive by forcing her to R2 early while I am still high health.

Also you:
>her R1 now requires her to be in range(so she can't use it from 1k range just to position herself for E or back-E and Q)

Can you like, stop contradicting yourself?

You said you want her to use both E and R1 to reach you, that's it's on live currently, but you also said you're ok with the nerf because now she can't use it "to waste both it and E to reach you". Now she doesn't need E to reach you, she can just get in range, R1 you, passive proc, E you, passive proc, then R2 and kill you. Sure, she can't reach you from miles away, but if you're that far, she doesn't need to reach you anyway to set you behind.

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}} 

Also, her R2 post nerf is slower than Amumu's Q. Just so you know.

> Her speed boost is 30% up to 50% and can be used while outside her W.
The one on live is 20-40% only when inside.

50% decaying slow for 2 sec is worse than 40% of non-decaying slow for as long as she is inside

> You said you want her to use both E and R1 to reach you, that's it's on live currently, but you also said you're ok with the nerf because now she can't use it "to waste both it and E to reach you". Now she doesn't need E to reach you, she can just get in range, R1 you, passive proc, E you, passive proc, then R2 and kill you. Sure, she can't reach you from miles away, but if you're that far, she doesn't need to reach you anyway to set you behind.

The problem wasnt in the exact order of spells, its that currently she doesnt even need to use them sometimes, and if she does, she is extremely free to do it in whatever order. E-R1, R1-E, R1-E shuriken, all that combined with W movespeed. If she is already close, she can use R1 to dodge things, to follow the flash over the wall or just to turn around and escape if things are not in her favor. Ult nerf kills most of these options, leaving her with either "ult from 600 range to get close" or "get close with E and use ult to chase after flash/dash". Not really a perfect nerf in my opinion, but its better than having none.

> her R2 post nerf is slower than Amumu's Q

The skillshot or the Amumu himself? Either way, its not really too slow. She will have more trouble with mobile champions, and Im not sure if that's ok.

Anyway, its just a first iteration of nerfs. If the feedback is, as you say, mostly negative from all kinds of players, there is a chance to have something changed

Amamu's bandages.

You have time to dodge them just by side stepping.

Having a near 3 minutes ult be even slower than that is a problem.

I don't mind them making it slower so people can dodge it easier, but not to the point where you can side step it, considering that unless she's ahead of you by a lot of gold and levels, she does it.

As for the R1 statement you made, I can see your point, but that's kind of a reason for skill expression? To be able to asses how you use your skills based on knowledge.

How about, allowing R1 to be used only when in 500 range of an opponent? Or only towards a 5/600 area around an opponent? We already have stuff in the game that react to directions, heck, her initial passive used to do the same, hit spell, get ms only when moving away from an opponent, proc passive circle, get ms only when moving towards an opponent. Give the same to her R1, so she can only use it towards an opponent and not just escape freely, it keeps the outplay potential as she can dash sideways to dodge stuff while in combat not specifically towards you, but it removes her options for simply running away.

Still allows her to outplay people but it also removes from her safety as she can't just dash away as easily. You can nerf stuff without fully removing skill expression.

> You have time to dodge them just by side stepping.
Having a near 3 minutes ult be even slower than that is a problem.

If it deals as much damage as it is now, and with her actual damage(Q-AA) being almost undodgeable, being able to dodge the execute is okay

> I don't mind them making it slower so people can dodge it easier, but not to the point where you can side step it

Excuse me, how else am i supposed to dodge skillshots?

> As for the R1 statement you made, I can see your point, but that's kind of a reason for skill expression? To be able to asses how you use your skills based on knowledge

Imagine if Yasuo's E was free targeted. It would add some more "skill expression" but will also remove the way for enemies to counterplay that with their own "skill expression" of guessing when he will E and at which target.
She also already has 2 free target dashes(E and R2)

> How about, allowing R1 to be used only when in 500 range of an opponent? Or only towards a 5/600 area around an opponent?

Im not an Akali player myself, so Im not sure how a restriction like this would work. Kaisa ult works like this, and I have a feeling its still too easy to dodge shit/escape with it. Again, she has 2 more free dashes for an outplay and an invisibility. There should be a way to outplay her too

>Excuse me, how else am i supposed to dodge skillshots?

It's an ult. The only other "slow" execution ult is Draven's and that one has the potential to damage you twice while he can redirect the return point, so for that one, it makes sense to be slower, and even that will be faster than Akali's R.

Otherwise allow me to side step Darius' ult, Jhin's 4th shot, Zed's ult + E, Nidalee's RQ (not the spear), Elise's RQ, and every other execute or high damage ability.

>Imagine if Yasuo's E was free targeted. It would add some more "skill expression" but will also remove the way for enemies to counterplay that with their own "skill expression" of guessing when he will E and at which target.
She also already has 2 free target dashes(E and R2)

Relativity my dear.

Yasuo's E is not only a basic ability but has a cooldown of 0.5 that goes down to 0.1. So as long as he has units he can dash to that weren't already dashed on or the per target cooldown went off.

Akali's R is an ultimate, and do I need to remind you again that it's one of the longest cooldowns in the game? On a champion that doesn't build much CDR anyway?

>Im not an Akali player myself, so Im not sure how a restriction like this would work. Kaisa ult works like this, and I have a feeling its still too easy to dodge shit/escape with it. Again, she has 2 more free dashes for an outplay and an invisibility. There should be a way to outplay her too

What other "2 free dashes"? If her E doesn't connect, it's a small hop backwards, and here's a tip, she throws the Shuriken AFTER she backflips, meaning that if there is something between you and her after the flip that can be hit by the Shuriken, it will hit that instead of you.

If it does connect, she can't "out play" you with it, as except with R1, she can't stop the dash, so you know exactly where she's going. Her E isn't Lee's Q to be stopped just like that.

As for her W. Do I need to say this again for the nth time? Bait it out, don't fight near it. If she has it everytime she wants to trade with you then you're doing something wrong.

And well, dodging stuff is the point. If you use it to dodge, it won't deal the damage nor activate her passive.

> It's an ult. The only other "slow" execution ult is Draven's and that one has the potential to damage you twice while he can redirect the return point, so for that one, it makes sense to be slower, and even that will be faster than Akali's R.

Lux ult has long cast time and can be sidestepped
Ashe ult is slow and can be sidestepped
Fizz ult is slow and can be sidestepped
Pyke ult has cast time and can be sidestepped, although this one is harder
No problem with being able to dodge a spell that kills you at 40% hp

> Akali's R is an ultimate, and do I need to remind you again that it's one of the longest cooldowns in the game?

Yes and even if her R1 only did 1 damage and was champion targeted, it would still be ok. Its 2 dashes, 2 instant passive procs and an execute

> What other "2 free dashes"?

E(the "small hop") and R2

> Bait it out

How a, lets say, lvl 11 immobile mage supposed to force Akali to use her W defensively? Or an ADC with same level? Or a support?
Also, why am I supposed to "bait" her W? Why can't Akali be forced to "bait" my CC and can instead dodge it with her dash sideways?

> don't fight near it

It would be nice if she couldn't just drop it from a range, run at me with bonus ms and hit her Q. When I see her using W, its not a "should i fight or back off for a while", its "im already dead unless im 1000+ range from her at that point"

> And well, dodging stuff is the point. If you use it to dodge, it won't deal the damage nor activate her passive.

That would be an argument if she had limited number of tools to deal damage. Say, Q with 10 sec cd. As it is now, she can afford to miss her E shuriken and both her Rs and still have enough damage to kill as well as enough mobility to run around in circles around her target

> [{quoted}](name=Posui Gart,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Yf6mdZZA,comment-id=00010000000000000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-17T17:14:27.462+0000)
>
> Lux ult has long cast time and can be sidestepped

don't compare with a champ who will try to stun lock you every 8 second with her Q.

Lux's ult used by someone who stuns you will not be escaped. (but often times zhonya'd)

With my sick MS Paint skills, I made 2 small graphs of the idea I showcased in the other commend.

- 1 http://prntscr.com/qp4amo

Akali can only use R1 if passes through that area, let's say, it's 400 range. If the R1 wouldn't pass through that, she gets the "invalid target" error when trying to cast it. The circle is centered on the enemy,

- 2 http://prntscr.com/qp49z2

She has free targeting dash, as long long as R1 is used within the 500 circle. So it still removes the "she dashes from 1000 range away" while allowing her some freedom of movement.

Stopping her from being overloaded with mobility is a good direction, and nobody except akali players are saying its too much.

Once she actually fits in the game reasonably her numbers can be adjusted.

Her ult has almost a 3 minutes cooldown and she rare builds CDR beside Zhonya.

The only way to adjust her numbers after that set of nerfs is to buff the CD on her R, meaning she will have more mobility when going for kills as it's lower cooldown, and increasing her damage, meaning she'll deal more damage.

And I don't know, can't put my finger on it, what was it that boards cry so much about her in the laning stage.....something not related to mobility.....what was it......oh yea, early dueling damage? Yea, if they go through with these nerfs, they may have to buff that, so hey, you guys should reap what you sow. 

Think these nerfs are good? Take the potential buffs as well then.

Or accepts these nerfs aren't what should happen to balance her and ask for the right nerfs instead.

Lower the MS on her passive, I'm ok with that, lower the damage on her passive, add an internal CD to her passive, either generic or per target, increase the Q CD. I'm ok with all of these and these are the nerfs she needs.

People just actually don't know how to play against her.

Believe it or not but I find laning against Akali fun when I pick Annie or Mao, or just in general. I know not everyone shares the same feeling, but I'm generally fine with it. I get tilted a lot more easily by Kassadin or Irelia, because they don't have 4 dashes. They have like... fucking... 10 dashes?

But don't worry, Kassadin and Irelia will lose 5 movement speed while Akali just loses her entire kit on the go.

I prefer to play against an Akali rather than a Fizz who will throw a fish and delete you off the map. Same goes for all the champs like (Ekko, Lee Sin, Morde, etc) who are dodging nerfs. Akali is at what? 45% winrate and still gets nerfed.
seriously though, Irelia? That poor champ is gutted.

The only thing Akali is going to have with these changes is mobility. She doesnt have the burst of an assassin. 
She can't carry games like many other assassins. She has to dance around her target to kill them and cc is her worst enemy.
Did you not read the whole thing? They haven't reduced the CD on her ult. So now you can dodge her ult and make her wait 3 mins to use it again. Also I didnt point out that she still has to wait before she can use her R2.

> She doesnt have the burst of an assassin.

I died to Q-AA-R2 more times than I would like to

> She can't carry games like many other assassins

"Many other assassins" don't carry games. They win by killing enemies, snowballing, killling them some more and making sure enemy team's ADC/mage doesn't get to play the game, they can't really win lategame teamfights on their own.

> you can dodge her ult and make her wait 3 mins to use it again

That's the point of a spell being dodgeable. Galio's ult is easier to dodge and deals less damage if hits, and its cd is around the same if not longer but everyone is ok with that

> I died to Q-AA-R2 more times than I would like to

You can't kill someone as Akali by just Q-AA-R2 unless the Akali is fed. She needs to Q-AA several times and use her E and R to get the kill. She is usually referred to as a bruiser rather than an assassin.

> "Many other assassins" don't carry games.

May I introduce you to Zed, Diana, Ahri, Ekko, etc?
> They win by killing enemies.

That's is technically how you carry as an assassin. Akali is good at that, but she sucks in team fights and taking objectives like many other melee assassins.
> That's the point of a spell being dodgeable.

That's not the case when you are talking about an assassin who relies on ultimate. Also, Galio and Akali are very different. We can't really compare the two.

sorry to tell you but the rework is a giant failure and riot just refuses to revert it and rework her again.
the current akali will never be in a state that is enjoyable. so yeah. you just gotta accept that
I persoanlly like the rework, I just don't like the direction of balancing they are going with.
